content.prompt: The designers of Chartres Cathedral intended medieval visitors entering the church to experience

choices.label: a somber mood by seeing the many reliquaries of saints who had died as martyrs lined up in the nave
a dazzling brightness caused by the vast nave being flooded with brilliant sunlight from wide openings
an impression of a space opening to the heavens, created by illusionistic paintings on the ceiling of the nave
a mystical atmosphere created by the colored light filtering through the many stained glass windows

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
